image.altText: A wide shot of the booking.com website on a laptop with a person sitting in front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland couple says people started arriving at their Sunshine Coast accommodation claiming to have made a reservation through Booking.com â€” but they had not listed the property on the platform.

title.children: 'That booking is a scam': Travellers targeted with fake listings on accommodation platforms

image.altText: Belinda Kerwin in hospital after being diagnosed with bowel cancer in June last year.

props.synopsis: When Belinda Kerwin, a bowel cancer screening nurse, developed symptoms herself she initially dismissed them, thinking she was too young.

title.children: Belinda thought she was too young to develop bowel cancer. The statistics tell a different story

image.altText: An old white man with a balding head speaks wearing a suit

props.synopsis: A government backbencher has spoken out against his party for gifting lobbyists more time to campaign on weaker gambling ad limits on TV and social media.

title.children: Labor slammed by own MP for giving gambling ad industry headstart on legislation

image.altText: A photo taken half underwater. A person is splashing into the blue water, while above trees and palms surround.

props.synopsis: There are fears that sacred, pristine sites are being put at risk by a government-backed push to grow cotton in the outback.

title.children: People travel from across Australia to swim these crystal blue waters. It's feared they'll dry up

image.altText: A row of EV charging stations on a suburban road.

props.synopsis: Electric car sales are accelerating and along with it, additional demand for electricity. It's driving questions about how the grid will cope with the growing number of large batteries waiting to be charged.

title.children: Electric cars are booming as a wall of demand barrels towards the power grid. There are risks, but also opportunitiesÂ

image.altText: A photo of the cornavirus.

props.synopsis: A new study finds that during September 2022, about 1.3 million Australians were living with long COVID and of that number about 55,000 were children aged four and under.

title.children: Long COVID has cost the Australia economy billions in lost work hours, new research says

image.altText: Black and white photo of woman in car without seatbelt

props.synopsis: Civil liberties advocates in Queensland remain concerned the cameras could capture nudity, underwear or private moments and are calling on the government to release the findings of two independent reviews into the privacy implications.

title.children: Call for mobile detection cam reviews to be made public amid fears drivers may be snapped in state of 'undress'

image.altText: Fatima Payman in emerald green pant suit and matching hijab smiles, her husband in black pants and jacket has arm around her

props.synopsis: The inside story of why senator Fatima Payman broke ranks with the Labor Party and the fallout that followed in the capital and at home.Â

title.children: 'Just toe the line': Fatima Payman's husband reveals struggle between Labor or love

image.altText: a young man smiling and holding a guitar

props.synopsis: Jetson's parents believe his death was one of the first overdoses to involve nitazene, which is increasingly being found in illicit drugs and counterfeit pharmaceuticals.

title.children: Struggling with anxiety, Jetson turned to the dark web to buy oxycodone. Just half a pill killed him

image.altText: Man surrounded by Gold confetti

props.synopsis: The Morning Show host Larry Emdur wins the award for the most popular person on Australian television. Here are some of the other key moments from the 64th Logie Awards.

title.children: Larry Emdur wins Gold Logie, Sam Pang lauded for his opening monologue and Raygun makes a surprise appearance

image.altText: Two boats, smaller vessel on the left with two people and a large boat on the right.

props.synopsis: A man is recovering in a Gold Coast hospital after being hit in the head by a whale's tail while out fishing with a friend on Sunday.

title.children: Fisherman slapped across face by whale's tail at Tweed Heads

image.altText: A main in a white coat holds up a small specimen container while looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Australian National University create a 'Trojan horse' method they believe could help in the fight against malaria and other potentially deadly parasitic diseases.

title.children: Malaria parasites love cholesterol and that could be their downfall

image.altText: A picture taken looking across a cricket ground, with the crowd, then the players and a light tower and apartments.

props.synopsis: A one-off Test will be played against England at the MCG in March 2027, while the future of the Gabba clouds Brisbane's future calendar.

title.children: Cricket Australia reveals plans for one-off March Test against England, as uncertainty surrounds Brisbane's future

image.altText: A large stage with a lit-up screen displaying 'DNC 2024'.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris has already been certified as the Democratic Party's candidate for president. So, the convention's real purpose will be to whip up support for her campaign in the hope it will motivate voters in November.

title.children: Kamala Harris heads to Chicago with hopes for a 'convention bounce'

image.altText: A composite image of Imane Khelif and Raygun

props.synopsis: Two incidents â€” both involving women competing in the Olympics â€” provide the latest grim proof of the often toxic, menacing and deranged nature of social media. And it doesn't stop with those in the public eye.

title.children: We're entering a new phase of the social media wars

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: Plummeting iron ore prices on the back of China's cooling property market could cost the federal government $3 billion in revenue and push the budget further into deficit this financial year.

title.children: China's property crisis could wipe $3b from federal budget

image.altText: White man with grey hair wearing white shirt and suit jacket slightly leans forward and poses for camera

props.synopsis: Alain Delon shot to fame in two films by Italian director Luchino Visconti, Rocco and His Brothers in 1960 and The Leopard in 1963.

title.children: French movie giant Alain Delon dies aged 88

image.altText: A man giving a speech with an animated expression and his hand extended to the side

props.synopsis: Donald Trump suggests Kamala Harris approaches economic policy in "a communist way" and calls her a "lunatic" ahead of the Democratic National Convention.

title.children: Harris campaign hits back at Trump's 'lies, name-calling, and confused rants' ahead of DNC

image.altText: Katarzyna Niewiadoma wearing the leader's yellow jersey, with her arms raised, smiling, on the winner's podium

props.synopsis: Poland's Katarzyna Niewiadoma has won her first Tour de France Femmes title, fighting off the challenge of defending champion Demi Vollering on the Alpe d'Huez who won a dramatic final stage â€” but not by enough to retain her crown.

title.children: Niewiadoma fights off Vollering to win first Tour de France Femmes title

image.altText: A person's naked back with red marks on the skin all down the spine

props.synopsis: Spinal cord stimulators used by some pain specialists to treat chronic back pain are being slapped with conditions or cancelled by Australia's medical devices regulator amid a review into the safety and performance of the controversial products.

title.children: Some spinal cord stimulators cancelled by TGA amid calls to have the 'dangerous' devices banned

image.altText: Photo illustration of Sydney Metro train with teal background and teal and white M sign in top left corner

props.synopsis: The transport project expected to reshape the future of Sydneysiders move around is set to open soon. This is what you need to know.

title.children: The futuristic stations, the stats and the catch: What you need to know about the new Sydney Metro City line

image.altText: A car on fire at the front of a shop.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an incident in Port Melbourne during which a car crashed into a hair salon, starting a fire which destroyed the premises.Â

title.children: Police investigate suspicious fire after car crashes into Melbourne hair salon

image.altText: composite picture of boy wearing an helmet and riding a steer

props.synopsis: Ex-bull rider Reece Wardlow acknowledges "life is dangerous" and believes the sport gives his son confidence.Â

title.children: This 10-year-old is riding bulls. His dad says he's a better kid for it

image.altText: Two children lean over a tap holding plastic cans for water, one looks sadly at the camera

props.synopsis: Polio, once eradicated thanks to almost all children in Gaza being vaccinated, has been detected again in the occupied territory.

title.children: A nearly eradicated disease has re-emerged in Gaza. What happens next?

image.altText: Close-up of a woman and a cat.

props.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Smitten is trying to earn her keep as a muster cat on her Western Downs cattle property, and isn't afraid of the 500kg cows she kicks up dust with.

title.children: Forget muster dogs, meet the wannabe muster cat Smitten

image.altText: A older woman in a light grey jumper and chunky black necklace sits with a group of young students around a table.

props.synopsis:
The screening program, developed in the UK, can be used on children as young as 3 to identify issues with language and literacy â€” and it's "easy and relaxed" according to one of the teachers involved in the trial.

Â

title.children: This school is trialling a new program to help turn around falling reading results

image.altText: Senate chamber

props.synopsis: The federal government is confident it can pass CFMEU and NDIS laws when parliament resumes this week but progress elsewhere is slower.

title.children: The government's agenda is bogged in Senate mud as parliament returns for another slow week

image.altText: Three men in orange ski wear pull a red flag off a large plaque on a sunny icy tundra

props.synopsis:
It might look like an ice-bound resort but China's latest Antarctic station, Qinling, has Australia's intelligence community concerned.Â 

Â

title.children: China's fifth Antarctic base has the world's spies watching. Should Australia be worried?

image.altText: Phoenix Crossland sent to the sin bin by Gerard Sutton

props.synopsis: An irate Newcastle Knights coach Adam O'Brien has hit out at veteran official Gerard Sutton over a series of controversial calls that took place in his side's heartbreaking loss to the Cronulla Sharks on Sunday.

title.children: 'I haven't seen that all year': Knights coach fumes over controversial sin bin, blocking calls in Golden Point loss to Sharks

image.altText: Troops fire guns from a tank in grass land.

props.synopsis: Belarus has sent a warning to Ukrainian soldiers, saying it has mined the Belarusian-Ukrainian border "as never before".

title.children: Kyiv blows up second bridge inside Russia as Belarus masses troops at border

image.altText: Elly-May Barnes, Kumi Taguchi, Robert Irwin and Julia Morris on the red carpet

props.synopsis: Here are some of the bold and bright looks we saw on the red carpet forÂ the 2024 Logies.Â

title.children: Logies red carpet: Check out the best fashion from TV's big night

image.altText: Chen Zi Jun works on a laptop on a narrow timber desk inside her flat, with a streaming camera mounted nearby.

props.synopsis: China's strenuous workplace culture demands intense hours with little time for life, prompting many young people to escape the grind â€” often without another job lined up or any concrete future plans beyond leaving the rat race.

title.children: Chinese companies demand 'work-life integration'. Young people are 'naked quitting' instead

image.altText: Chairman of Cricket Australia Mike Baird looks at the camera as he purses his lips

props.synopsis: Former New South Wales premier Mike Baird says the Liberal Party's failure to nominate close to 140 candidates for next month's local government elections is a "tragedy."

title.children: Former NSW premier 'heartbroken' by nominations error as Liberals say they have found escape clause

image.altText: An aerial view o a bridge over a river lined with trees, as high rises stand in the background.

props.synopsis: Singapore's home ownership rate jumped from 30 to 90 per cent over two decades. Many of its land and housing policies align with the ideas of Henry George.

title.children: How did Singapore achieve a home ownership rate of 90 per cent? Can Australia learn anything from it?

image.altText: Two women with their arms around each other laughing

props.synopsis: They're often met with eye rolls and are underestimated by the people they go to rescue, but these women are doing what they love.

title.children: Trailblazing female towies showing other women the way
